name: df-cht
body: |- wceq(ccht, cmpt(s0, cr, csu(s1, cin(co(nat0, cicc, cv(s0)), cprime), cfv(clog, cv(s1)))))
comment: Define the first Chebyshev function, which adds up the logarithms of all primes less than ` x ` , see definition in [ApostolNT] p. 75. The symbol used to represent this function is sometimes the variant greek letter theta shown here and sometimes the greek letter psi, ψ; however, this notation can also refer to the second Chebyshev function, which adds up the logarithms of prime powers instead, see ~ df-chp . See ~ https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chebyshev_function for a discussion of the two functions. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-Sep-2014.)
